thread.title: Hurricanes recall McGinn, Pesce from Checkers
thread.title_full: Hurricanes recall McGinn, Pesce from Checkers

title: Hurricanes recall McGinn, Pesce from Checkers
text:
Hurricanes recall McGinn, Pesce from Checkers 
Posted 5:50 p.m. yesterday Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * Are you human? * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters 
Raleigh, N.C. — The Carolina Hurricanes announced Wednesday that the team has recalled forward Brock McGinn and defenseman Brett Pesce from the Charlotte Checkers of the American Hockey League. 
McGinn, a second-round selection (47th overall) in the 2012 NHL Draft has totaled 29 points (17 goals and 12 assists) in 70 games at the AHL level for the Checkers. The Fergus, Ont., native tallied 172 points (93g, 79a) in 227 games for the Guelph Storm of the Ontario Hockey League. 
The 21-year-old tallied two goals in his first two games this season with the Checkers. 
McGinn is the younger brother of Buffalo Sabres forward Jamie McGinn and Syracuse Crunch forward Tye McGinn. 
Pesce, a third-round selection of the Hurricanes (66th overall) in the 2013 NHL Draft is in his first professional season after completing a three-year collegiate career at the University of New Hampshire. He tallied 43 points (11g, 32a) in 110 games for the Wildcats. 
The Tarrytown, N.Y., native made his professional debut with Charlotte in April, tallying one assist in four games. 
Pesce, 20, tallied two assists in the Checkers’ first two road games of the season last week against the Iowa Wild. 
The Hurricanes will begin a seven-game road trip Friday in Detroit against the Red Wings. Detroit edged Carolina 4-3 in the Canes’ home opener on Saturday. Credits
